questions.question: What is Scrum Poker?
questions.answer: Scrum Poker (also known as Planning Poker) is an agile estimation technique where team members vote simultaneously using numbered cards to estimate task complexity. It’s widely used in agile frameworks like Scrum to improve the accuracy of story point estimates.

questions.question: How does Pontim work?
questions.answer: Pontim lets you create estimation rooms where your team can vote in real time using Fibonacci numbers. Everyone votes at the same time, and results are revealed together for discussion. The platform offers sound notifications, customizable rooms, and an intuitive interface to make estimation easier.

questions.question: Is Pontim free to use?
questions.answer: Yes, Pontim has a free plan with basic features for small teams. We also offer paid plans with advanced features like unlimited rooms, vote history, and integrations for larger teams.

questions.question: What are the benefits of Planning Poker?
questions.answer: Planning Poker improves estimation accuracy by combining multiple team perspectives, reduces individual bias, encourages productive discussions about task complexity, and helps spot hidden risks and dependencies.

questions.question: How do I create a room in Pontim?
questions.answer: To create a room in Pontim, click on 'Create Room,' give your session a name, pick a voting system (Fibonacci, T-shirt sizing, etc.), and share the link with your team. It’s simple and doesn’t require sign-up.
